decks.notes: This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent with cards like Stifle and Daze while also using cards like Fatal Push to control the board. It also utilizes powerful creatures like Nethergoyf and Orcish Bowmasters to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes card manipulation tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency in draws. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and Psychic Frog can be used for additional disruption. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy with access to both blue and black mana sources.

The main concept of this deck is to use Cloudpost ramp to quickly generate a high amount of mana, allowing the player to cast powerful threats such as Karn, the Great Creator, Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes cards like Crop Rotation and Vesuva to further accelerate the mana production. Additionally, disruptive elements like Wasteland and Boseiju, Who Endures are included to control the opponent's game plan. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats through efficient mana ramp.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly ramping up with Eldrazi temple and other lands, using aggressive creatures like Devourer of Destiny and Glaring Fleshraker to apply pressure early on. The use of cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Chalice of the Void disrupts the opponent's strategy and allows for a smooth path to victory. The deck also includes powerful spells like Kozilek's Command and Sowing Mycospawn to further control the game. With the combination of efficient mana production and strong creature presence, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a fast win.

The deck is focused on assembling the Cephalid Breakfast combo, which involves using Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill your library and then Dread Return Thassa's Oracle from the graveyard to win the game. The deck includes protection in the form of Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler to ensure the combo can go off smoothly. Additionally, there are control elements like Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats from the opponent. The deck also utilizes Urza's Saga for tutoring and generating additional value.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with aggressive threats like Ocelot Pride and Witch Enchanter, backed up with removal like Swords to Plowshares and Solitude to maintain control. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional synergy with the creature-heavy deck, while cards like Seasoned Dungeoneer and Guide of Souls offer card advantage and resilience to removal. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Chancellor of the Annex and Eagles of the North disrupts the opponent's game plan, while lands like Wasteland and Karakas provide additional utility. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

This deck revolves around the combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone, allowing you to mill your opponent's entire library in one turn. Using Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer to tutor and recur your combo pieces, along with disruption spells like Pyroblast and Ensnaring Bridge to control the board, this deck aims to quickly assemble its combo while disrupting and outpacing the opponent. Additionally, utilizing cards like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal for mana acceleration, this deck is designed for explosive plays and fast wins in the Legacy format.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom alongside various support cards like Nomads en-Kor and Shuko to create a powerful synergistic engine. The deck also includes disruption elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Will to protect the combo and control the game. The inclusion of tutors like Green Sun's Zenith and card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder help to find key pieces of the combo quickly. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Death's Shadow and Nethergoyf while disrupting opponent's resources with cards like Daze and Force of Will. The use of Fetchlands and Mishra's Bauble helps to enable Death's Shadow's ability to deal huge amounts of damage. The deck also utilizes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Sink into Stupor to control the opponent's game plan. Overall, the strategy revolves around aggressive plays and disrupting the opponent's resources to secure a quick victory.
